Hey! First of all, awesome torrent. Great instructions and easy to make it work, Thanks!

However, now the zombies won't work. Night comes and eveything, but the zombies just don't appear. Any tips on how we can get zombies back in the game? Thanks :D

Open
server.properties

Look for
monsters=false

and set to
monsters=true

see: http://www.minecraftforum.net/viewtopic.php?f=35&t=39400&sid=e90041b9a35e73ba966e863ffbb8298b

The problem is not the name spoofer, notch is aware of the bug and is working to fix it.  The current fix involves either replacing a dll, or starting the game offline and then connecting to the internet.  Either way, it sucks.

Funny story, the name spoofer doesn't work unless you are connected to the internet :D
I'll look at messing with it this weekend to allow you to launch the game from a .jar located in the same folder as the name spoofer, but notch will probably fix the bug before I fix the spoofer.

To save everyone trapsing through that forum that was posted, basically the only solution seemed to be that you had to be disconnected from your internet BEFORE starting the game, so, close your game, disconnect from your internet, restart game (sound should then come on) and reconnect to internet if you wish.

Got the world working.. however, me and my friend are invincible how to make us non invicible??

SOUND FIX
Load a world or connect to a server, and once you are ingame, hold down F3 and press S.

This should turn your sound back on. You have to do it every time that you restart Minecraft, however.

(F3 is the debug key, and F3+S reloads web resources)
the newest update, 1.1.2_01 (I think that's what it's called) fixes this.

So i downloaded several versions of minecraft cause i kept getting the same problem. and i finally figured it out.
In every torrent they tell u to paste the .minecraft folder into the Appdata/.minecraft.
Instead. Delete the old Appdata/.minecraft and copy the new one into Appdata.
Then just open and dont type n e thing on the  username + password and it works :)

@Everyone having problems. 

NetWork HOSTING: To get other join you'll need the computer your running the server IP. By doing so Go to Start > All Programs > Accessories > Run. When you get run open type "cmd" after that type "ipconfig" you'r looking for IPV4 Address. Thats the IP in which you use to connect with. ALSO make sure you are using the port number you put on the server Default is 25565 (Connect Example 10.101.0.10:25565)

Outside Network Hosting. You'll need you IP so google my IP thats they IP you'll give to your friends. Also note you need setup port forwarding. The port is whatever you make it on server. Default 25565.

Still having trouble on network. Try opening port on router. And give it a shot from that...

Need anymore help just ask
@Xeferoth.. It should be just in a folder I belive. If not it's win.rar.. If your talking about running the game you need java.scripts.

Every time I try to start minecraft_name.jar, a cmd box opens up and goes instantly away, if I spam it I can see it complaining something about "Main class not found"

?!?! How can I fix this :/ All . jar files have the problem

Problem solved. If you have the same thing, heres a fix. Copy the following code to notepad and save the file as NAME.bat
@echo off
java -jar minecraft_name.jar
pause
